    • fitting RelDists distributions with gamlss

    fitting RelDists distributions with gamlss

    Jaime Mosquera & Johan Marin

    2019-07-08

    fittingDistributions.Rmd

    This is a temporal vignette, only for some tests

    Random data generation with EW family:

    require(RelDists)
## Loading required package: RelDists
y <- rEW(n=100, mu=2, sigma=1.5, nu=0.5)

    Fitting with traditional gamlss families:

    require(gamlss)
fits <- fitDist(y, type="realplus")
fits$fits
##       EXP        GA       WEI      WEI2      WEI3        GP   PARETO2 
##  11.92117  12.29779  12.65852  12.65852  12.65852  13.87871  13.87871 
##  PARETO2o        GG       GIG     BCCGo      BCCG     BCPEo       GB2 
##  13.87871  13.97134  13.99627  14.20025  15.69829  15.97134  15.97223 
##      BCTo    LOGNO2     LOGNO        IG    IGAMMA 
##  16.20251  33.59240  33.59240 107.84822 115.91479
fits$failed
## [[1]]
## [1] "exGAUS"
## 
## [[2]]
## [1] "LNO"
## 
## [[3]]
## [1] "BCT"
## 
## [[4]]
## [1] "BCPE"

    Fitting with gamlss some our families:

    require(gamlss)
require(RelDists)

familias <- c("EW", "ExW", "FWE")

md <- gamlss(y~1, control=gamlss.control(n.cyc=500, trace=FALSE), family=NULL)
fits <- chooseDist(md, type = "extra",  extra = familias)
## minimum GAIC(k= 2 ) family: EW 
## minimum GAIC(k= 3.84 ) family: EW 
## minimum GAIC(k= 4.61 ) family: EW
fits
##            2      3.84      4.61
## EW  13.92900  19.44900  21.75900
## ExW 14.70036  20.22036  22.53036
## FWE 97.61908 101.29908 102.83908

    Fitting with gamlss families and our "reldists" family:

    require(gamlss)
require(RelDists)
fits <- fitDistPlus(y, type="reldists")

fits$fits
fits$failed
